newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - January 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - January 27.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Monday's Daily Variety:
* Walt Disney Co and Comcast Corp will buy Time Warner's majority stake in E! Entertainment Television for $320 million, sources said. The deal may be announced as early as this week.

* Sony Corp's "Jerry Maguire" and Walt Disney Co's "Metro" appeared tied at box office during Super Bowl weekend. Sony estimated "Jerry Maguire's" take at $5.9 million, while Buena Vista offered a more conservative dollar estimate for "Metro."

* Wall Street firms considering moving money back into cable TV include Kohlberg Kravis Roberts and venture capital fund Carlyle Group. Sources say value investors are looking for opportunities in the sector after its stocks fell to all-time lows during the past year.
* Sources say the Musicland Group again has asked the Big Six record distributors to let it defer making payments due on records shipped as part of a move to stave off a bankruptcy filing.

* Sony Pictures Classics co-presidents Michael Barker, Tom Bernard and Marcie Bloom are in final talks to renew their contracts with corporate parent Sony Pictures Entertainment, Sony sources said Sunday. An announcement is expected later this week.

* "Sunday," a tale about a one-day love affair between an actress and a homeless man she mistakes for a renowned director, won the grand jury prize for dramatic film and the Waldo Salt Screenwriting Award at the Sundance Film Festival.
